Uses of Class
db.DatabaseException

Packages that use DatabaseException

Uses of DatabaseException in db
 

Subclasses of DatabaseException in db
 class DuplicateKeyException
          Custom exception used for instances where a requested record is not found in the current database
 class RecordNotFoundException
          Custom exception used for instances where a user attempts to create a new record with the same primary key as an existing record
 class SecurityException
          Custom exception used for issues that arise with database and record locking
 

Methods in db that throw DatabaseException
 void DBEngine.addRecord(Contractor newContractor)
          Adds a new contractor record to the database.
 void Database.addRecord(Contractor newContractor, long clientID)
          Adds a new record to the database by calling the DBEngine addContrator method
 void DBEngine.bookContractor(java.util.List<java.lang.String> key, java.lang.String customer)
          Checks to see if a existingRecord is valid and then writes a customer number to the correct position in the database file.
 void Database.bookContractor(java.util.List<java.lang.String> key, java.lang.String customer, long clientID)
          Calls the DBEngine method bookContractor() passing in the values the user has entered.
 void DBEngine.write(long location, java.lang.String data)
          Basic method that writes to the database.
 

Constructors in db that throw DatabaseException
Database(java.lang.String path)
          Creates a new Database object
DBEngine(java.lang.String path)
          Creates new DBEngine
LocalConnector(java.lang.String path)
          Creates a new LocalConnector object
 

Uses of DatabaseException in gui
 

Methods in gui that throw DatabaseException
 void ViewController.addRecord(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String specialties, java.lang.String staffNo, java.lang.String rate, java.lang.String customer)
          Receives information from the view and packages it in to a new contractor object.
 void ViewController.bookContractor(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String city, java.lang.String customerNo)
          packages user input from the view into a list and sends it to the database.
 

Constructors in gui that throw DatabaseException
ViewController(java.lang.String path, int port, Mode mode)
          Creates a new ViewController.
